trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.ObjectCreating"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.ObjectCreated"></xref> events of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceEventArgs> class is used in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceView.OnObjectCreating%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceView.OnObjectCreated%2A> methods to provide access to the business object instance before any data operations that are using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control and business object are performed.
The business object is set and accessed using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceEventArgs.ObjectInstance%2A> property.

By adding an event handler delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceView.ObjectCreating> event, you can create an instance of the business object in custom code instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> performing the instantiation.

This is useful when you want a non-default instance of your business object or to call a non-default constructor to create the instance; the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> always calls the default constructor to create an instance of the business object it works with.

You can also add an event handler delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.ObjectCreated> event, which enables you to access any publicly exposed members of the business object to perform any additional initialization or work.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceView.OnObjectCreating%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceView.OnObjectCreated%2A> methods are not called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control, if the business object method that performs the data operations is `static`.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control exposes many events that you can handle to work with the underlying business object at various times in its lifecycle.
The following table lists the events and the associated <xref:System.EventArgs> classes and event handler delegates.
Event
EventArgs
EventHandler
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.ObjectCreating>.
Occurs immediately before the instance of the business object is created.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.ObjectCreated>.
Occurs immediately after the instance of the business object is created.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Selecting>.
Occurs before the data is retrieved.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Inserting>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Updating>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Deleting>.
Occur before an insert, update, or delete operation is performed.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Selected>.
Occurs after the data is retrieved.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Inserted>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Updated>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Deleted>.
Occur after the insert, update, or delete operation is completed.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.ObjectDisposing>.
Occurs before a business object is destroyed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceEventArgs"></xref> class using the specified object.
The business object with which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource"></xref> interacts to perform data operations.
Gets or sets an object that represents the business object with which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource"></xref> control performs data operations.

The business object the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource"></xref> uses to perform data operations; otherwise, `null`, if `null` is passed to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceEventArgs"></xref>.
